intro: Eriocarpum tracyi, commonly known as Tracy's eriocarp, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy fruits that are typical of the genus Eriocarpum. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
